LEGAL_BASIS_OTHER.P: Procurement award procedure applying to European Union external actions financed from the general budget of the European Union and the European Development Fund (EDF)

TITLE.P: Supply and Delivery of Motorcycles for EU-Coffee Action for Ethiopia (EU-CAfE) Project

SHORT_DESCR.P: Supply and delivery of 38 single cylinder, two/four stroke minimum 170 cc motorcycles of extra heavy duty tropical types with rear carrier and toolkit which are intended to be used for general service in Ethiopia on- and off-road on slope terrains. They shall be required to operate trouble free under predominantly poor conditions including low grade of fuel, uneven, bumpy and loose, gravel road surfaces and thick sand/dust as well as varying temperature from 0-550 C, climates from humid tropics to arid desert, and altitudes from sea level up to 2 500 m above sea level.

Supply and delivery of 38 single cylinder, two/four stroke minimum 170 cc motorcycles of extra heavy duty tropical types with rear carrier and toolkit which are intended to be used for general service in Ethiopia on- and off-road on slope terrains. They shall be required to operate trouble free under predominantly poor conditions including low grade of fuel, uneven, bumpy and loose, gravel road surfaces and thick sand/dust as well as varying temperature from 0-550 C, climates from humid tropics to arid desert, and altitudes from sea level up to 2 500 m above sea level.

EU_PROGR_RELATED.P: European Union-Coffee Action for Ethiopia (EU-CAfE), Financing Agreement FED/2017/038-977 (11th EDF).

INFO_ADD.P: Financial data to be provided by the candidate in the standard application form or the tenderer in the tender form must be expressed in EUR. If applicable, where a candidate refers to amounts originally expressed in a different currency, the conversion to EUR shall be made in accordance with the InforEuro exchange rate of April 2021 which can be found at the following address: http://ec.europa.eu/

SUITABILITY.P: See internet address provided in section I.3).
